item.title: no serious boo boo for berra in spring fall
item.description: baseball hall of famer yogi berra was released from hospital and pronounced ok after a brief stay as a precaution thursday after the 85-year-old former yankee slipped and fell before a spring training game.

item.title: rains, mudslides kill 10 in cholera-stricken haiti
item.description: u-prince - a storm unleashed torrential rains, mudslides and flooding in haiti, killing at least 10 people, haitian officials said on tuesday after thunderstorms pounded several caribbean countries.

item.title: rangers sting royals with ninth-inning burst
item.description: elvis andrus stroked a game-winning rbi single with two outs to complete a ninth-inning comeback in the texas rangers' 7-6 victory over the kansas city royals sunday.

item.title: this week's health industry news
item.description: health care is on the agenda at a large meeting of officials in the nation's capital.

item.title: liberia uneasily linked to ivory coast conflict
item.description: at least 100,000 refugees have fled to liberia, while liberian mercenaries are heading in the opposite direction, to take part in the ivorian conflict.

item.title: nhl fines bruins' ference $2,500 for obscene gesture
item.description: the nhl has fined boston bruins defenseman andrew ference $2,500 for making an obscene gesture to the crowd in montreal.

item.title: on jeter, cashman broadens his view
item.description: the yankees general manager said he thought more about the team's success, adding that jeter's struggles probably masked the fact that some of his teammates also were not hitting.

item.description: dealbook's michael j. de la merced posts on the auction of blockbuster from the united states bankruptcy court in manhattan.

item.title: japan mulls tokyo electric nationalization
item.description: japan may nationalize tokyo electric power as mounting costs and public anger threaten the future of the company at the center of the country's deepening nuclear crisis.

item.title: business briefing | consumer goods: rubbermaid cuts its full-year profit forecast
item.description: newell rubbermaid, the maker of sharpie pens and plastic storage containers, cut its full-year profit forecast friday on slumping consumer spending, setting off a 12 percent decline in its share price.

item.title: the fix is in and don't blame us, says new york police union
item.description: ever since traffic tickets were invented, police officers have been asked to make them disappear for family, politicians and celebrities, a top police union chief said on wednesday.

item.title: a-rod swings yankees out of slump
item.description: alex rodriguez launched two home runs to lift the new york yankees out of their funk with a 6-2 victory over the tampa bay rays on tuesday.

item.title: observatory: a recording studio found under the pacific
item.description: whales all over the pacific ocean pick up the songs of humpbacks, turning them into worldwide hits.

item.title: from federer's supporters, cheers and i-told-you-so's
item.description: after roger federer beat novak djokovic in the semifinals of the french open, there was nothing but optimism among his biggest boosters.

item.title: allen renz: teacher of the hour, 14 times daily
item.description: allan renz keeps telling his wife that he will work less, and she keeps telling him she doesn't believe it.

item.title: n.h.l. puts freeze on games in russia
item.description: the rangers and the washington capitals will not open the 2011-12 n.h.l. season in russia, nor will any n.h.l. clubs play kontinental hockey league clubs in exhibition games in russia next fall.

item.description: 'twilight' star bryce dallas howard is expanding her family.

item.description: nearly nine years after elizabeth smart was abducted from her bed, a judge ordered a street preacher to life in prison for raping her while holding her captive for months.

item.description: a statement by the medical examiner in hennepin county, minn., said the rangers player's death was accidental.

item.description: the campuses for the university of richmond and virginia commonwealth are five miles apart but have little in common, except that both universities have teams in the round of 16.

item.description: as andre ethier chases joe dimaggio's record hitting streak, jimmy rollins, who has the longest hitting streak of the last 24 years, thinks the record could fall.

item.title: egypt approves reforms in historic referendum
item.description: a big majority of egyptians approved amendments to the constitution in a referendum, results showed, opening the door to early elections seen as favoring islamists and figures affiliated with the old ruling party.

item.title: south africa plans bid for 2022 commonwealth games

item.title: russia's putin says ruling party needs new ideas
